sentences.en: At the moment, you are in favour , but , believe me , when you are no longer in vogue, I will be.
sentences.cn: 别看你一时走红, 等你过了劲, 就该轮到我了.

sentences.en: Cycling enjoyed a vogue at the end of the nineteenth century.
sentences.cn: 19世纪末骑自行车曾风行一时.

sentences.en: Especially nowadays when hopping around is the vogue?
sentences.cn: 在旅游溜达这么盛行的当今年代.
花卉地毯变成了时髦货.

sentences.en: In Britain there's been something of a vogue for these books.
sentences.cn: 在英国，这些书还算流行。

sentences.en: Long skirts were then all the vogue.
Pale colours are much more in vogue than autumnal bronzes and coppers.
sentences.cn: 浅色比黄褐色和红棕色这些秋季色彩更流行。

sentences.en: She had a short vogue as a film star.
sentences.cn: 她曾有一段时期是一位受欢迎的电影明星.

sentences.en: Short hair came back into vogue about ten years ago.
sentences.cn: 大约十年前短发又开始流行起来了.

sentences.en: Suntanning first came into vogue in the mid-1930s.
sentences.cn: 晒黑皮肤最早流行于20世纪30年代中期。

sentences.en: The novel had an enormous vogue in the 1930's.
sentences.cn: 这本小说在三十年代曾广为流传.

sentences.en: The song had a great vogue at one time.

sentences.cn: 以孩子为中心的教育潮流

sentences.en: This style of writing had a vogue.
This style of writing has had a great vogue.
sentences.cn: 这种写作风格曾大为风行.

trans.tran_en: a popular and fashionable style, activity, method etc
